net.kolotyluk.java.files

Class FilesIT

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.kolotyluk.java.files.FilesIT

  • public class FilesIT
extends Object
    Integration Test Cases

    While these are technically unit tests, they are long running, on the order of 10 minutes or more. Consequently, they are best run as Integration Tests.

    These tests are run in order because some tests rely on the results from previous tests.

    Author:
    Eric Kolotyluk

    • Method Detail

      • setUpBeforeClass

        public static void setUpBeforeClass()
                             throws IOException
        Fixture Setup

        Create some temporary test files. These are quite large because the Unit Under Test is designed for media files. Also, the UUT is based on memory mapped files, and you can only map about 2 GiB at a time, so we want to test files larger than this. Finally, the reason for using memory mapped files is to increase performance, so we want to measure the performance and compare it against something like org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.contentEquals().

        Throws:
        IOException

      • tearDownAfterClass

        public static void tearDownAfterClass()
                               throws IOException
        Fixture Teardown

        We have created some really large temporary files, so it is important to delete them before we run out of space on our file system.

        Note: sometimes if there is a problem with the tests, this code does not get executed, so we should find a way to make this part more robust.

        Throws:
        IOException

      • tc00_contentEquals

        public void tc00_contentEquals()
                        throws IOException
        Test Identical File Comparison

        This test is designed to see not only if the comparison of two identical files is correct, but also if it is efficient for large files.

        Throws:
        IOException
        See Also:

      • tc02_contentEqualsApache

        public void tc02_contentEqualsApache()
                              throws IOException
        Test Identical File Comparison Using Apache

        Many people use Apache's library for comparing files, but it is not as fast for large files, so we are doing more of a performance comparison here. It also helps to test with an external standard to triple-check that the files are equal.

        Throws:
        IOException
        See Also:
        tc07_contentEqualsIsQuick()

      • tc07_contentEqualsIsQuick

        public void tc07_contentEqualsIsQuick()
        Is the Unit Under Test faster than Apache?

        net.kolotyluk.java.files.Files.identical(referenceFile, identicalFile) should execute faster than org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.contentEquals(referenceFile.toFile(), identicalFile.toFile()); for large files because it is using memory mapped files.

      • tc08_notContentEqualsIsQuick

        public void tc08_notContentEqualsIsQuick()
        Is comparing different files faster than comparing identical files?

        Comparing files that are different in the first byte should be significantly faster than than comparing identical files. One problem with an earlier version of the code was it was using 

        if (!buffer1.equals(buffer2)) return false;
        which was slow, probably because it was loading the entire map into memory before the comparison.
